intro: Uvaria hiran, commonly known as the African star fruit or star apple, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The fruit is typically yellow or orange when ripe, with a star-shaped appearance due to its distinct lobes. It is often grown for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses. The plant thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
